alert.note: Alert for Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 09 at 5:52PM EDT until July 09 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR SOMERSET COUNTY... At 552 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms had produced heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2.5 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional light rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area with more precipitation moving in. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks, streams and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Somerset County This will impact T4 R5 NBKP, Dole Brook Township, T5 R19 and Comstock Township. Sharp rises on streams and creeks around Dole Pond, Penobscot Lake and Long Pond will threaten North Woods campgrounds. Washouts likely on Dole Pond Road and the Golden Road. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
